definition: A nonpolar amino acid with a small methyl side chain.
example or note: Hydrophobic; often used in alanine scanning.

definition: A branched-chain hydrophobic amino acid.
A hydrophobic amino acid with a branched side chain.
A hydrophobic branched-chain amino acid with two chiral centers.
A sulfur-containing hydrophobic amino acid.
example or note: Often the first amino acid in protein synthesis (AUG).

definition: An aromatic amino acid with a benzyl side chain.
An aromatic amino acid with a phenolic hydroxyl group.
A bulky aromatic amino acid with an indole ring.
A polar amino acid with a hydroxyl group.
example or note: Involved in enzyme active sites and phosphorylation.

definition: A polar amino acid with two chiral centers.
example or note: Essential amino acid; can be phosphorylated.

definition: A polar amino acid with an amide side chain.
A polar amino acid with an amide side chain derived from glutamate.
A negatively charged amino acid at physiological pH.
A negatively charged amino acid involved in metabolic pathways.
A positively charged amino acid with an ε-amino group.
A positively charged amino acid with a guanidinium group.
An amino acid with an imidazole ring that can be protonated near physiological pH.
example or note: Acts as a buffer; important in enzyme catalysis.

definition: A cyclic amino acid that introduces kinks in polypeptide chains.
The smallest amino acid lacking a side chain.
A polar amino acid with a thiol group.
